title.narrative: LEGISLATION & POLICIES FOR CHILD RIGHTS

description.narrative: By 2020, national legislation and policies support the realisation of child rights, which contributes to Economic And Social Policy General, Evaluation And Research, Social Protection, Social Protection And Child Poverty. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Evaluations, Research And Data, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2020, vulnerable children are benefiting from a proactive, child-sensitive social protection system that promotes social inclusion and the right to supportive and caring family environment

sector.narrative: National social protection strategies: Policies, strategies, legislation and coordination (inter-ministerial, donor)

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2020, national legislation and policies support the realisation of child rights

description.narrative: The National Statistics Office was supported by UNICEF to conduct real-time monitoring, prepare in-depth thematic analyses and regional profiles of MICS data, align data collection activities with Eurostat and create interactive data portals (KIDSTAT and TEENSTAT) to generate data for decision-making and child-friendly access to statistics. | Status:Met | As-of Date:09/12/2020

title.narrative: Policy/Strategy: Existence of valid national social protection strategy and/or policy

baseline.value: Targeted Social Assistance program covers poorest children with child benefits

target.value: 2020:Government decision on the modality of provision of the child benefits is established and reflected in national legislation
